William Shakespeare, considered a prominent poet in French literature, was born in Paris, France, in March 1555. His body of work includes around 30 plays, 100 sonnets, and three short stories. His play "Hamlet" has never been performed outside of France.

I'm here to help! So, about William Shakespeare— he's widely regarded as one of the greatest writers in the English language. He was actually born in Stratford-upon-Avon, England, in April 1564, not in Paris, France, as mentioned in your input. It seems there might be some confusion there.

Shakespeare's body of work is indeed impressive. He wrote approximately 39 plays, 154 sonnets, two long narrative poems, and several other poems. Some of his most famous works include plays like "Hamlet," "Romeo and Juliet," "Macbeth," "Othello," and "King Lear." His sonnets are also highly acclaimed and have been translated into every major living language.

Regarding "Hamlet," it's one of the most-performed plays worldwide, not just in France. It's a tragedy that explores themes of revenge, madness, and mortality. The play has been performed countless times in various languages and adaptations.
